page.title: 06CLARILAW FARM
page.content: {A farm}of 1000 acres owned until 1981 by the Duke of Roxburgh's estates and let to a tenant farmer. {The farm}which stands at 155 metres above sea-level consists of grassland and grazing for cattle and sheep. Some of the land is very rocky. {Now privately}owned, run by a working Manager who lives in one of the 8 cottages. Other 3 cottages are occupied by farm workers, 4 rented. {The charming}old farmhouse with adjacent outhouses formerly occupied by the tenant is now empty. {Great improvements}have been made to increase production of cattle and sheep breeding by buiding a large shed for wintering early lambs and for hay storage. {A large silage}shed has been erected for cattle feeding.
